meanings.definition: Feel intense or passionate dislike for someone.
meanings.sent1: She was hating the rainy weather.
meanings.sent2: He is hating the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent3: The cat was hating the idea of taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to be hating the harsh winds.
meanings.sent5: The child's face showed pure hating towards the bitter medicine.

meanings.definition: Have a strong aversion to something.
meanings.sent1: They were hating the idea of going to the dentist.
meanings.sent2: She is hating the sound of nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent3: The dog was hating the sight of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The student seemed to be hating the thought of failing the test.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fish made him hating seafood even more.

meanings.definition: Show intense hostility towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The rival teams were hating each other during the match.
meanings.sent2: He is hating the new policy changes at work.
meanings.sent3: The character in the movie was hating the villain with a passion.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to be hating the peaceful sky.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's eyes were hating the enemy across the battlefield.
